Package gamelogic

Class GameInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • gamelogic.GameInstance
  • public class GameInstance
extends Object
    Logic for the game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Move answer
      Answer to the key that the user is trying to guess.
      static int blackpegs
      number of black pegs on any given guess.
      private String[] colorz
      Array for picking a random color when enable duplicates is off.
      private boolean ongoing
      tells the game class if the game is over or not.
      static int turnCount
      tells what turn the player is on.
      static int whitepegs
      number of white pegs on any given guess.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameInstance()
      Constructor for GameInstance, set ongoing to true, populates colors, makes an answer, sets the pegs and turn count to starting position.

      Guesses a color which then populates the peg arrays based on if their answer was right or wrong.

      Generates a random color and if enable duplicate colors is off, generate 4 random different colors.

    • Method Detail

      • getAnswer

        public String[] getAnswer()
        Returns:
        returns an array of strings which is the answer for the game

      • setAnswer

        public void setAnswer​(String color1,
                      String color2,
                      String color3,
                      String color4)
        Sets the answer for the GameInstance. Used for debugging.
        Parameters:
        color1 - first color passed.
        color2 - second color passed.
        color3 - third color passed.
        color4 - fourth color passed.

      • randomColor

        private String randomColor()
        Generates a random color and if enable duplicate colors is off, generate 4 random different colors.
        Returns:
        returns a color as a string.

      • guess

        public void guess​(String color1,
                  String color2,
                  String color3,
                  String color4)
        Guesses a color which then populates the peg arrays based on if their answer was right or wrong.
        Parameters:
        color1 - first color guessed.
        color2 - second color guessed.
        color3 - third color guessed.
        color4 - fourth color guessed.
